etymology.description: Depicts a cave or hole, resembling a small dwelling or opening
etymology.interpretation: The character 穴(穴) (xué, "cave") visually represents a hole or cave with an open entry, suggesting a sheltered space similar to a primitive dwelling or burrow.

examples.chinese: 山里隐匿着一个深深的穴(山裡隱匿著一個深深的穴)。
examples.pinyin: Shān lǐ yǐn nì zhe yí gè shēn shēn de xué.
examples.english: A deep cave is hidden in the mountains.

examples.chinese: 探险家在悬崖下发现了一个幽静的穴(探險家在懸崖下發現了一個幽靜的穴)，据说里面住着古老的精灵(據說裡面住著古老的精靈)。
examples.pinyin: Tàn xiǎnjiā zài xuán yá xià fāxiàn le yí gè yōu jìng de xué, jù shuō lǐmiàn zhùzhe gǔlǎo de jīng líng.
examples.english: The explorer discovered a quiet cave beneath the cliff, and it is said that ancient spirits dwell inside.

examples.chinese: 河岸边的岩石上有一个小穴(河岸邊的岩石上有一個小穴)。
examples.pinyin: Hé àn biān de yán shí shàng yǒu yí gè xiǎo xué.
examples.english: There is a small cave on the rock by the riverbank.
